titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to Archives of Industrial Society (AIS) Assorted Maps and Atlases, 1830-1990 AIS.Maps
titlestmt.author: Debora A. Rougeux.

note.p: 136 maps selected for scanning; mounted online 5.1.13 17 more scanned by Tri-State and online 4.14.2014

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-07-08 17:25:59 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Archives of Industrial Society (AIS) Assorted Maps and Atlases

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: University of Pittsburgh. Archives Service Center

did.abstract: This finding aid lists the maps and atlases found in the Archives of Industrial Society (AIS) at the Archives Service Center that are not associated with any particular collection. The maps are mainly of Pittsburgh, Allegheny County and the southwestern Pennsylvania region. The atlases mostly include Sanborn maps, Hopkins plat books, atlases of the city of Pittsburgh and environs and of counties in Pennsylvania. Digital reproductions of some of the maps are available online.

odd.head: Previous Citation
odd.p: Archives of Industrial Society (AIS) Assorted Maps and Atlases, 1830-1990, AIS.Maps, Archives Service Center, University of Pittsburgh

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Archives of Industrial Society (AIS) Assorted Maps and Atlases, 1830-1990, AIS.Maps, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The University of Pittsburgh holds the property rights to the material in this collection, but the copyright may still be held by the original creator/author. Researchers are therefore advised to follow the regulations set forth in the U.S. Copyright Code when publishing, quoting, or reproducing material from this collection without the consent of the creator/author or that go beyond what is allowed by fair use.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into seven series:
Series II. City of Pittsburgh Department of City Planning Maps of Pittsburgh, 1985-1987
Series III. Municipalities in Allegheny County, 1873-1965

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This finding aid lists the various maps and atlases housed in the Archives of Industrial Society (AIS) at the Archives Service Center that are not associated with any particular collection. The maps primarily cover Pittsburgh, Allegheny County and the southwestern Pennsylvania region and include, but are not limited to, maps of highways, boroughs, townships, counties, zoning districts, election districts, census tracts and property lots. Also included are a set of aerial photographs of the City of Pittsburgh. The atlases include Sanborn maps, Hopkins plat books, atlases of the City of Pittsburgh and environs and of counties in Pennsylvania. Note that the Historic Pittsburgh website provides online access to all of the published Hopkins plates for Pittsburgh.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: Digital reproductions of some of the maps are available online.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains maps of the City of Pittsburgh and its immediate environs. Similar maps may be found online in the Darlington Digital Library Maps website.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains maps and aerial photographs created by the City of Pittsburgh Department of City Planning and is further divided into three subseries: 1. Aerial Photographs; 2. Topography; and 3. Parcels.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains maps of individual boroughs and townships in Allegheny County, arranged alphabetically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains atlases of Pittsburgh, Allegheny County and other counties in Pennsylvania, as well as of Pennsylvania and neighboring states. It is divided into five subseries: 1. Sanborn Maps; 2. Hopkins Plat Books and Atlases; 3. Other Pittsburgh Atlases; 4. Pennsylvania Counties; and 5. Pennsylvania and Other States.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Please note that the Historic Pittsburgh website provides online access to all 47 volumes of maps published by the G. M. Hopkins Company for Pittsburgh. The Archives Service Center holds 40 of the 47 volumes. These plat maps cover the greater Pittsburgh area through the years 1872 to 1940.
